body: job is still running but i see that all downloaded files are now with the correct date

Can you reproduce the issue and lists the steps with 1 file rather than syncing large amounts of files?

I tried testing with one file and can't reproduce the date being wrong with multi threaded downloads:

```

weird, because i clearly have a date bug.
i forgot to say that i use crypt. 
i'm going to do the same test like you and post result

it's an NTFS drive, no compression.
if i mount the google suite storage to a drive letter and copy a file to this drive, date is correct
i made a sync command, but i got same error date with a copy command
And for completeness, if you run the same copy with the same file with multi threaded on 0, you get the proper date, correct?

yes, date is correct.
i run a job with --multi-thread-streams=0 and leaving the file on drive :
```

you made a copy test, i made a sync test
but i got same error date with a copy

note that i'm not running with admin rights under windows.
drive has been formated from an mmc running with admin rights and i suppose default permissions

This looks like it is a Windows only problem - I can't reproduce it on Linux....

Multithread copy calls `SetModTime` on the local object after the file has been written in  a very similar way to non multithread copy.

However the file is still open at the time the `SetModTime` is called - I wonder if that is the difference...

Can you try this? I think it should fix the problem - the tests pass on windows so hopefully it will!

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.51.0-046-g50127d53-fix-3994-multithread-time-beta/

rename.to: Multithread copy not setting modtime correctly on Windows

body:
I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) in 15-30 mins and released in v1.52

I'll most likely put it in a 1.51.1 point release too
